name: Acute Upper Respiratory Infection (likely viral)
symptom_templates: fever, sore throat, runny nose, cough
common cold symptoms: cough and rhinorrhea without high fever
viral upper respiratory infection with sore throat
immediate_protocol: Supportive care: paracetamol for fever, advise ORS if dehydrated, rest. Avoid antibiotics unless bacterial signs.

dosage_guidance.adult: Paracetamol 500-1000 mg every 4-6 hours as needed; max 3 g/day.
dosage_guidance.pediatric: Paracetamol 15 mg/kg per dose every 4-6 hours (max 60 mg/kg/day).

name: Community Acquired Pneumonia
symptom_templates: fever and productive cough with breathlessness
significant fever and difficulty breathing, chest findings
immediate_protocol: Assess SpO2; give oxygen if SpO2 < 92%. Start empirical antibiotic per local STG; arrange referral if severe.

dosage_guidance.adult: Amoxicillin 500 mg TDS for 5 days (depending on STG); or alternative as per STG.

name: Diarrheal Illness (Acute watery)
symptom_templates: acute onset watery diarrhea and vomiting
loose stools and signs of dehydration
immediate_protocol: Assess dehydration; start ORS, zinc for children, consider antibiotics only if dysentery or cholera suspected.

dosage_guidance.adult: Oral rehydration per WHO; zinc for children 20 mg daily for 10–14 days (children >6 months).

name: Malaria (Uncomplicated, suspected/confirmed)
symptom_templates: fever with chills and rigors, periodic pattern
malaria suspected in endemic area with fever and splenomegaly
immediate_protocol: Perform RDT/microscopy if available. If positive: give ACT (Artemisinin-based Combination Therapy) as per NVBDCP. Severe malaria → urgent referral.

dosage_guidance.adult: ACT as per NVBDCP: Artesunate 200 mg + SP (1500/75 mg) single dose; dosing adjusted by age/weight.

name: Dengue Fever (without warning signs)
symptom_templates: acute high-grade fever with body ache and rash
viral fever in endemic season, dengue suspected
immediate_protocol: Supportive management: paracetamol for fever, oral fluids. Avoid NSAIDs/aspirin. Monitor for warning signs (bleeding, persistent vomiting, abdominal pain).

dosage_guidance.adult: Paracetamol 500–1000 mg every 6 hours as needed (max 3 g/day).
dosage_guidance.pediatric: Paracetamol 15 mg/kg every 6 hours as needed.

name: Pulmonary Tuberculosis (Presumptive/Confirmed)
symptom_templates: chronic cough with weight loss and fever
suspected TB with cough more than 2 weeks
immediate_protocol: Collect sputum sample for CBNAAT/Xpert MTB/RIF. Initiate treatment under NTEP if confirmed. Isolate patient until on therapy.

dosage_guidance.adult: Fixed-dose combination as per body weight: 2 months HRZE + 4 months HR.

name: Hypertension (Newly Detected)
immediate_protocol: Confirm BP with 2–3 readings. Counsel on lifestyle: reduce salt, stop smoking, weight control. Start pharmacotherapy if persistent >160/100 or as per risk profile.

dosage_guidance.adult: Amlodipine 5 mg once daily; may increase to 10 mg. Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5–25 mg once daily.

name: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
symptom_templates: excessive thirst and urination with weight loss
newly detected high random blood glucose >200 mg/dL
immediate_protocol: Confirm with fasting blood glucose / HbA1c. Counsel on diet, exercise. Start metformin unless contraindicated. Refer if complications suspected.

dosage_guidance.adult: Metformin 500 mg once daily with meals; increase gradually to 1 g BD as tolerated.
